review.title: A Study on Artificial Intelligence IQ and Standard Intelligent Model
review.abstract: Currently, potential threats of artificial intelligence (AI) to human have triggered a large controversy in society, behind which, the nature of the issue is whether the artificial intelligence (AI) system can be evaluated quantitatively. This article analyzes and evaluates the challenges that the AI development level is facing, and proposes that the evaluation methods for the human intelligence test and the AI system are not uniform; and the key reason for which is that none of the models can uniformly describe the AI system and the beings like human. Aiming at this problem, a standard intelligent system model is established in this study to describe the AI system and the beings like human uniformly. Based on the model, the article makes an abstract mathematical description, and builds the standard intelligent machine mathematical model; expands the Von Neumann architecture and proposes the Liufeng - Shiyong architecture; gives the definition of the artificial intelligence IQ, and establishes the artificial intelligence scale and the evaluation method; conduct the test on 50 search engines and three human subjects at different ages across the world, and finally obtains the ranking of the absolute IQ and deviation IQ ranking for artificial intelligence IQ 2014.

sections.text: Intelligent modelAs mentioned above, the Von Neumann architecture consists of five components, i.e. calculator, logic control unit, memory, input system and output system. By comparing the intelligent standard model described in Section 1 and the knowledge interaction diagram of the intelligent standard model, it can be established that the von Neumann architecture consists mainly of two parts: the innovative and creative function, namely the ability to find new knowledge elements and laws based on existing knowledge, and the ability to enter these into the computer memory and control system and achieve knowledge interaction with the outside world via the input / output system, and the external knowledge base and cloud storage, which can achieve knowledge exchange. However, the external storage function of the von Neumann architecture serves only one system. sections.heading: 4. Definition of Artificial Intelligence IQ
sections.text: As mentioned above, a standardized intelligent system must have four characteristics, i.e. the ability to acquire knowledge, the ability to master knowledge, the ability to renew knowledge, and the ability to feedback knowledge. If we intend to evaluate the intelligence level of an intelligent system, we should test the four characteristics simultaneously to verify its level of development, as shown in Fig.4.1. The ability to acquire knowledge can be verified by testing whether the knowledge can be fed into the intelligent system; the ability to master knowledge can be verified by testing the volume of the knowledge base; the ability to innovate can be verified by testing how much knowledge can be converted by the intelligent system into the content of the new knowledge, and the ability to feedback the knowledge can be verified by testing whether the standard intelligent intelligent system can transmit to the outside knowledge base. Based on the intelligence evaluation model to the content of the new knowledge, and the ability to evaluate the feedback of the knowledge can be verified by testing whether the standard intelligent system can transmit to the outside knowledge base. sections.heading: 6. Summary and Prospect
sections.text: Through testing, we obtain the following results and conclusions: The general IQ of the search engines tested is far lower than that of the human groups tested. Google's IQ, as the top ranking among the machines tested, is less than half that of the children at age 6; the knowledge acquisition and feedback skills of the search engines tested are weaker than those of the human control groups. In terms of the ability to master knowledge (general knowledge, computation and translation), the search engines tested have caught up with or exceeded the human control group, but their capacity for knowledge innovation is almost zero, indicating that the AI system has a very low capacity for innovation. Therefore, we recommend that future research into the AI system, including search engines, should focus on how to improve the ability to innovate, especially in the aspects of association, selection, creation and discovery of laws. Starting in 2015, we can test smarter systems that use the AI test system, including the search engines developed by Google, IBIRIQ, and IBIRIQ, as well as the human search engines developed by Google SIRIQ and IBIRIQ, and IBIQ, as the IBIQ system specifically for IBIRIQ and IBM.
